channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cars contiuously blocking cycle lane, 4th July
item.description:
The cycle lane here is nearly always blocked by illegally parked cars. Cyclists have to drive around the bollards into the path of cars emerging from Henrietta Street. Maybe a camera to catch all offending vehicles and fine them? Clearly the double yellow lines are no deterrant. It is an accident waiting to happen as cars and commercial vehicles come around that blind corner quite fast.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 276 High Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ridiculous high trees, taller by 50% than the houses in canning road,, 3rd July
item.description:
I have been reporting this issue for years and nothing is done, all of these trees have ash die back and should be removed, I am fed up of collecting up 4-5ft long branches from my garden, if one hit me would they then be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Canning Road, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All headgear over grown obstructing the paths down to the newly opened bridge.., 3rd July
item.description:
All hedges so overgrown, now making the footpaths unsafe to use. Hedges now blocking road signage, growing over the road edging stones. Also lots of old sign frames still un collected. In some areas you can’t see oncoming vehicles where verges are so overgrown. Needs urgent attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Cotswold Court Park Old Gloucester Road, Staverton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedges on Lansdown Road, 3rd July
item.description:
The hedges along Lansdown Road, and particularly near Westal Green, are spilling onto the footpath and forcing pedestrians to walk in the cycle path at the risk of being knocked over by speeding cyclists. I suspect you may be waiting for fledglings to leave the nests but thought I’d check whether there are plans to cut back the hedges soon? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Regent House Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles over growing footpath, 3rd July
item.description:
These are right a face height for the children walking to school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 Rippledale Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bush blocking path, 3rd July
item.description:
It looks as though someone has had a new fence put in and in order to do that they have chopped down ivy and dumped it in the footpath used by the Lakeside Primary kids each day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 13 Hazebrouck Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, 2nd July
item.description:
Street lights not working in this area of Cirencester Road. This stretch of road is completely dark at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 116 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cans left at the location, 2nd July
item.description:
The location is again the entrance to the Old Quarry off Cleeve Common Road. Drinks cans have at least been bagged up and left at the entrance for someone else to collect. There is probably food waste in the bags judging by the activity seen of the local wild life. Please can it be cleared up - the regular waste collection from the Commons Bins would be able to deal with this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lazy People, 2nd July
item.description:
Please can this be collected?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose very noisy drain cover., 1st July
item.description:
Drain cover makes a very loud clang every time a vehicle drives over it. It wakes us and our children up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 95 Ermin Park, Brockworth

item.title: Dog Feaces everywhere, 30th June
item.description:
Dog poo is everywhere all over the footpaths. trod in smeared every where and lots of lumps of it waiting to be trod in. It's hardly avoidable. We need a dog waste bin installed in this area of the bridge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Boleyn Cottages Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet
